author: parchioso
title: Get this for Wampa and the snowspeeder
review:
The highlight of the set needless to say is Wampa, although it is still a little comical, but I would say it is better designed than TaunTaun, the big claw that can hold a minifig is quite interesting.

 

But the coolest thing from the set would still be the snowspeeder, yes, there are already Nth versions of it and this one may not be any much different than the rest, but it is always exciting to see a Snowspeeder coming, the Hoth battle is just too fascinating for many of us.

 

The structure is a little disappointing though, it is shallow and does not look good, and it is amusing to see how Lego tries to add a castle skeleton to Star wars.

 

I am not sure if the Luke in the set is a new minifig, but the Rebel Pilot should be the same Zev from 8083 I believe.

 

This is a good set, not perfect but worth buying a set or two.

 

I have a pictorial review at: http://brickand.me/2010/06/19/LegoStarwars8089HothWampaCaveReview.aspx

author: wouterdb
title: Nice but expensive snowspeeder
review:
The cave itself isn't special. No moving parts or something..

The snowspeeder is really beautiful, with some nice features and detail

Pro:
- great snowspeeder
- wampa
- light saber in ice

Contra:
- very expensive (50 euro)
- pilot mini-fig can not be fixed in the cockpit and his arms are too much in the air, so you better not use the first yellow plate (step 2 of the manual)
- cave = not very special or playable

author: arctrooper170
title: Legoman7777's Reviews: 8089 Hoth Wampa Cave
review:
Hello everyone, this is my first review for the summer 2010 Star Wars sets. These reviews will be divided into 4 parts: Box, Build, Minifigures, and Set. Here we go.

 

Box: The box shows the cave with the Snowspeeder flying in behind it to save Luke Skywalker (he is using the force to get his lightsaber from the snow) from the Wampa who is ready to eat him. It is also the first set with the new Dark Blue logo with Captain Rex on it.

 

Build: The build starts off by building the minifigures as always but along with bag one is the Wampa and the body of the Snowspeeder. The Wampa is just like the Taun-Taunin terms of building. The Snowspeeder body is almost the same as the old one in set 7666. Bag two is the wings of the Snowspeeder (again like 7666) and the assembly of the Snowspeeder, so far you have a good scene of Minifigures, Wampa and Snowspeeder. Finally in bag three is the cave itself. It is a fun build that again reminds me of the "wall" in set 7666.

 

Minifigures:

  • Luke Skywalker- He is brand new with Hoth gear like the rebels in set 8083. Same helmet as the rebels too, so just think of a rebel trooper from set 8083 with dark gray arms and a blue lightsaber.
  • Sev Senesca- He is the same as he is in set 8083, with his orange pilot clothes and gray pattern on his helmet. Only difference is he has a trans-orange "visor" on his face. He has no weapon.
  • Skeleton- This is your basic skeleton with exposed ribs and boney arms and legs. He has a classic smiley face.
  • Wampa Ice Creature- This is the main reason you would buy this set, (if you didnt get it for the Snowspeeder) he is just incredibly detailed with fur marks down his body, teeth impressions, movable detailed horns, and my favorite the left arm can hold pieces like the chicken and lightsabers and the right arm can hold large pieces including minifigures. Great now I can feed my many Ahsoka's to something :).

Set: Lastly we have the set, it is composed of the Snowspeeder and the Wampa's Cave. The Snowspeeder has a dual opening cockpit the can store 2 minifigures and up to 2 lightsabers. The wings can move up and down, and each have a flap that just like in the movie is used for slowing down the speeder as its flying. It also has a working winch in the back to save Luke or trip 8129 AT-AT Walker. The cave doesnt do too much other than look great, but it has a spot for Luke to hang upside down and a flick-lever to have Luke "use the force" to get his lightsaber back. The cave also has a nice Taun-Taun remains and fits in with all the other Hoth sets.

 

I recommend this set to anybody who wants a Hoth diorama or loves Classic sets.

author: frostlass
title: Lego 2010 great set!
review:
This set is awesome! You can find it at your toysrus.
   now to the pros and cons:

                          pros:
  • new wampa monster
  • snowspeeder
  • new box
  • zev senesca minifig
                       cons:
  • should come with a tauntaun
  • lightsaber shooter doesn't work well
             Well I recommend this set to any lego star wars fan!

author: Shistavanen_brick
title: "What's the matter, girl - do you smell something?"
review:
I wondered when some kind of set would emerge, that portray the hardships of becoming a living popsicle for the carnivous Wampas. And so in 2010 it came out! How does it match the scene in the movie, then? Well, the box looks very interesting (due to the fact that they have a cool background behind the actual "cave") but the set is sort of lacking things. 

Obviously, the snowspeeder is nice and makes a great addition to the ships of the rebel fleet. It is really nice to build and looks great. You only need to sturdy the wings as they can fall off. The Wampa is... both good and bad. Good is that it has two different hands. One can actually grasp a minifigure which can illustrate the movie scene greatly. Bad, or more that its appearance looks a bit daft, was slightly disappointing. The minifigures are nice, I think this Hoth-Luke is a new one. I can't recall seeing the torso anywhere else. The pilot with the new painted visir looks stern.

Onto the cave then. It's not really a cave of sorts... more like thin "ice walls" like a hallow scenery of a school-play. The detail that can hold Luke in place is quite good though, and it looks "real" enough. But there should be something more. What would be necessary to recreate the scene would be to give Luke his own taun-taun in this set, not just the animal skeleton. You could maybe complete this with the 7749 Echo Base I also do wonder why there is a human skeleton there in the wampa cave. Hungry much? Overall, a good set - that doesn't feel complete. It's like buying part 1 of something and then you need part 2 to make it complete.

Pros:
  • Snowspeeder!
  • Cool minifigures
  • Wampa

Cons:
  • Clearly overpriced
  • Stickers
  • Needs another taun-taun

author: commandermark
title: snowy times
review:
this set has its good things and bad things. this set is a bit small the cave is tiny the only up sides on this set are the wampa, that can hold a minifigure and some meat at the same time, the snow speeder that has a little hook to help luke escape, and the way luke is upside down.

i think it is a bit of a rip of because 50 bucks for a little tiny set, not worth it.

i would give this set 6/10

author: Carl
title: AWESOME!
review:
I bought this set today for $70 NZD. It was down from $100, but I still don't think it's worth either of those prices. I'd say about $50 or less. But anyway, onto the set. Let me tell you just what this set is: AWESOME!

Pros
  • AWESOME WAMPA!
  • Luke Skywalker with cool Hoth outfit
  • Zev Senesca
  • I always like a good skeleton (new arms make it look cool)
  • Cool lightsaber throwing mechanism
  • Place for Luke to hang upside down from (just like in movie)
  • Neat little rib cage thing
  • Chicken leg 
  • The whole cave itself is really cool
  • Snowspeeder
Cons
  • Not much room - or places -in the cave for the Wampa to stand. I would've like a bit more floor space in the middle
  • Snowspeeder cable thing

This set pleases me for 2 reasons:
1: It is awesome!
2: Now that they have done a Wampa, when 2013 comes around they have no excuse not to make a new Jabba's Palace with a Rancor!

author: Duq
title: Where have I seen that Snowspeeder before?
review:
There are really two sides to this story; there's the Wampa and its cave and there's a Snowspeeder.

The Snowspeeder looks a lot like the one from 7666 which in turn was strongly based on 4500. The body and the shape of the wings are identical, the only difference is in the engines. Like 7666 the instrument panel, the engine tile and the stripe in front are stickers, not printed parts. The pilot still lies awkwardly in his cockpit and the flaps on the engines still don't close properly like they did on 7130, the very first Snowspeeder back in '99.
In other words it's a minor redesign that doesn't improve on its two predecessors.

The Wampa looks ok but moving hips would have been nice. As it is the legs, body and head are a single piece. just like the Taun taun. Only the arms can move, using Technic axle pins in its shoulders. Its right hand can hold utensils while its left hand can hold a brick.
The cave is very simply but effective. The nice collection of white slopes and tiles makes for a convincing ice cave. The real fun is in the details though. There's the opening for the light saber that throws the saber out when you tap it. The Taun taun carcass out of light-clips and cow-horns looks great. Then in the other corner is a skeleton, held in place by its hand holding a pin. And then of course there's poor Luke hanging upside down...

A slightly disappointing Snowspeeder, pity about the Wampa's hips, but great details on the cave. And of course just because of the Wampa it's a must have to accompany 7749, the Echo base set with the Taun taun.

author: legoDad42
title: WONDERFUL HOTH PLAYSET(and a must get if you don't have a Snowspeeder)!
review:
The Hoth Wampa Cave is a wondeful playset and a great addition to Echo Base (7749), Rebel Trooper Battle Pack (8083) and Snowtrooper Battle Pack (8084). Your kid (7 yrs. on up) will have loads of fun and little trouble building the Wampa Cave with Luke dangling above in the rafters awaiting his fate from the Wampa himself...right after he finishes his turkey leg of course...while Zev swooshes around in his nicely designed Snowspeeder desparately looking for Luke.

 

PRO's...

  • Well designed Snowspeeder.  It's quite similar to previous Snowspeeder models but if you've never gotten one it's a must get set. Nice shape and fairly sturdy. Top view looks great (note: I believe the rear gun is different than previous sets).
  • Cockpit Opens closes in two parts. Front, longer end opens for pilot, then back section (attached to front canopy) tilts open for rear gunner/navigator.
  • Rear grappling hook on a wench.
  • 2 front cannons and one rear laser/grappling gun.
  • Cockpit interior has a sticker panel showing a silohette of an AT-AT.
  • Left and right rear wing flaps open to reveal electronic/interior engine details (stickered).
  • Wampa Cave is nicely designed with front large cave opening(simply designed) to fit the Wampa itself. Also to the left of the front we have a small, dark gray rock formation (small BURP)
  • Interior of cave has stalactites (where you'd attach Luke too, or any unlucky tresspasser).
  • Taun Taun skeletal remains.
  • A launcher for Luke's lightsaber mimicing his telekinetic force powers from the movie. Neat feature where you put in the lightsaber (blade first) into a technique 2x1 brick and tilt up, then snap down (quickly but not too hard) and it'll shoot out the saber towards Luke up above (make sure saber is put in ALL the way to the hilt and tilt the mechanism up before snapping down to work properly. Also hold the Cave firmly when doing this).

MINI-FIGs...

  • The Wampa is the star fig. for this set. Nicely designed all around with movable horns (which look like the Taun Taun tusks), movable arms and nice, sharp graphic detail for the fur. Left hand can hold a mini-fig and right hand can hold the turkey leg and the Skeleton figure. Hoth Luke Skywalker is a new mini-fig. New head and new Hoth torso print (front/back) but goggles and hat are the same as the Rebel Troopers from set 8083. Zev Senesca is the same X-Wing pilot w/helmet from set 8083. The Skeleton is the familiar fantasy era skeleton (happy faced).

CON's...

  • Sparse interior cockpit details for Snowspeeder.
  • Cockpit canopy can come off from time to time when opening/closing.
  • Stickered details. Wish it was printed tiles.
  • Wampa Cave details a bit too simple but effective though.
  • Wampe figure's legs not poseable. Also wished head would tilt/turn.
  • Snowspeeder needed to be a bit bigger model. Nicely designed but a bit small.
    Rear gun of Snowspeeder is only a horn piece. Needed a better design.
  • Taun Taun should've been added to this set while the Snowspeeder should've been with the Echo Base set.
  • No hand held blaster weapons.

Overall a really fun playset. I highly recommend this for your kid even though it's about $5-$10 dollars too much, it has 2 unique figures, a cool lightsaber play function and a nice Snowspeeder along with the Cave make it high on playability.

For the AFoL, MOC/MOD on the Cave to expand it more. Redesign the rear gun and MOC the front cannons for a better Snowspeeder look.

author: callum43
title: Sweet
review:
I had a choice this or doukous thingy but i thourght this was better it was expensive but i love it

the figures aren't bad but the snow speeder gets 100,000 out of 10

could be better but hey

author: desire4one
title: Single Wampa looking for Ice Shack Roomate
review:
Everybody has been waiting for it, and now we've got it - Wampa.

I found the set a bit lacking.  I will say that the "boxed set" feels a little fuller due to the fact that you get to build the snowspeeder and the cave and you get the furry ice monster, but personally, I would have felt better spending less money and just getting the Wampa with a few miscellanous filler pieces.

This is my first Snowspeeder, and I found it lacking.  It doesn't have a lot of "cool" factor, but you do get a decent cockpit piece and a 2 cannon pieces.  They aren't that easy to come by these days.  The wings are a bit fragile and minifigs slide around if you try to sit them in the cockpit.  That and they have to practically lay down to fit inside.

The cave itself is a stretch of the word "cave".  A better discription would be "ice-shack".  It's basically two walls with a roof.  Lots of white pieces though.

The skeleton and ribcage were good additions in my opinion. It gives a bit of the flavor of the film and environment.  All we need now is a Tauntaun to eat.

Pros

  • Complete Snowspeeder w/rope and grappling hook.  AT-AT's beware!
  • New Luke minifigure and Rebel Pilot.  Who doesn't need more rebel pilots?
  • Wampa.  He'll take on a AT-ST all by himself.
  • Ribcage and icles give a good recreation.

Cons

  • The

author: Jayr17
title: Some techniques to fix the flaws of Great Set
review:
Great set as the only one currently available with the Snow Speeder! Get this one if you don't have a Snow Speeder, you want a Wampa or look in his Snow gear from Hoth.

 The build is pretty straight forward, and no real unusually difficult bricks or techniques for 10-12 year olds. A seven year old may need some help with the cannon or the grappling hook.

Some Things to make it better (quick fixes):

  • 1. Grappling Cannon is only a megaphone and can't hold the grappling hook (the directions just have it dangling). Suggestion: find a black barrel and add it to the back of the megaphone. The Grappling hook will now fit through the open top and can stay there until the Navigator (back seat person) is ready to fire it at the AT-AT to trip them.
  • 2. Pilots computer is on the floor. When you build the Snow Speeder they put two grey flat 2x1 pieces together and the front white piece attaches to these to form the front of the Speeder. UNfortunately they just put the "computer" screen brick that gets the sticker of the AT-AT on the floor and now the pilot has it at his feet not in front of him. If you have two extra 2x1 flat pieces from another set just put them under the "computer" otherwise just move the two that come with the set under the "computer" brick. Now it is level with the rest of the top of the Speeder (where the Windshield comes down), it is where the pilot can see it, and it will actually help hold the pilot in (since you can't  lock him onto the yellow bricks if he has a co-pilot/navigator). Note: if you use the ones included in the set, the front is only held on by one connection (not recommended by LEGO).

So overall a great set, to combine with 7749 Echo Base, and maybe some AT-AT walkers (motorized or not). The price is at the top end of its range, but not as bad as the train sets mark up.

 PROs:

  • Wampa, Snow Speeder, New Luke in Hoth gear, Light Saber launcher, lot's of white pieces for Snowy landscape

CONs:

  • Missing some easy fixes (written above), Wampa legs and head (don't move), Needs Echo Base to have the Taun-Taun

author: Huge_Nerd
title: Love the Hoth Wampa Cave!
review:
Got this at the Lego Store in NYC! I love it!

 

Pros

  • -awesome Wampa with chicken leg!
  • -really nice, new Luke figure
  • -Zev Senesca (my brother's favorite random SW character)
  • -really nice snowspeeder; I love the AT-AT sticker in the cockpit
  • -nice looking cave with fun little lightsaber gimmick; Luke looks great hanging there and the bones are a nice touch
  • -satisfying build
  • -the orange pieces are strangely appealing

Cons

  • -Zev sits a little weird in the cockpit
  • -the string for the tow cable was a pain for me

author: woodall_aidan
title: Very,Very,Very Sweet Set!
review: I got this set today. I was merely shocked to see it on the shelf. This set included Luke Skywalker in his Hoth gear, Zev Senesca, and the Wampa. It also had a Snowspeeder, and the Wampa's cave. The Snowspeeder was not very different from the 1st edition. The Wampa's had the open doorway with icicles hanging down. There was also a small 2x1 section above the doorway for you to clip Luke Skywalker above the doorway, like in the movie. In the corner of the cave, you can slip Luke's lightsaber in this hole, and you press down on the back of the tile and the lightsaber goes flying, as if Luke uses the Force on it. Tip: Put the cave on a table or something when launching the lightsaber. There should be more of an effect. I will rate this set 10/5!

author: Moscadini
title: Hoth vs. Wampa
review:
Well... here are going to be my Pros & Cons first...

Pros:
  • Wampa Cave is "cute"
  • Luke Skywalker
  • Skeleton
  • Tauntaun skeleton backbone
  • Tauntaun

Cons:
  • Snowspeeder (should have included 2 snowspeeders when they are in search of Han & Luke)
  • Cave could have been "slightly" larger or with at least a black drop wall in the back
  • Like everyone else...
  • Stickers
  • Turkey Drumstick... really?, there were Turkeys in Hoth???? (could have done a better "style" meat bone"

Things that they could have added:
  • Han Solo in Hoth Gear
  • Another Tauntaun with "sorta" split belly
  • Another Hoth Headgear Hat for the Skeleton
  • Another Snowspeeder

Stickers:
Now, with the stickers, I believe I understand why we get sticker sheets now rather then being printed on the piece itself.  It may seem a lot of work for all of us; but if you think about it... it is "Cheaper" to print a sheet of stickers then it is to print on the piece itself.

author: David1971
title: A good playset, and better than it looks on the box
review:
This is another of those sets which is actually better in real life than it looks on the box. It's hard to do good photos of 3D Lego models I suppose, so it's not their fault.

But the pictures I'd seen of this set made it look slightly disappointing - the 'snow cave' in particular just looked like a few bricks thrown together. But it's actually pretty good, quite spiky and icy and quite nicely done.

The Luke Skywalker in Hoth outdoor gear (rather than snowspeeder pilot gear) is very nice, and the Wampa - with very finely calibrated ability to hold a minifig aloft in his left hand - is great of course. You can imagine they went through a number of sculpture versions before they arrived at this - it's more cartoonish than terrifying, but I think that works well. It's kinda 'fun' without looking stupid. Plus you get the pilot Zev Senesca, and the humorous touch of the Wampa's previous victim in skeleton form.

The snowspeeder seemed, I think, very different from the last time I built a Lego snowspeeder which, I suppose, must have been set #7130 in 1999, twelve years ago! This one is done well, with room for two minifigs (although their seats are have no grip and nothing to hold them in place, so they slip around and look a bit silly - especially as they have to have their arms raised in the air!) - and grappling hook.

Overall this is a good playset, and an excellent addition to the other Hoth sets ... lots of scope for quite complex snowy battles and scenarios these days!

author: lostcarpark
title: Lovely, but pricey.
review:
This is really two sets in one box, the Wampa Cave and the Snowspeeder.

The Snowspeeder

This is the fourth Minifig scale Snowspeeder LEGO have produced, though it's very similar to the one that came with Echo Base. There are some minor changes to the rear, and slight colour changes. The scale is about the same as the previous versions, and all four versions can easily be combined in a display (the differences work well as they're not meant to be completely uniform). The only pity is that only one pilot is included.

The Wampa Cave

The cave is nicely put together, and looks pretty good for the very limited number of bricks used. The use of slopes and cheesers give it some nice irregular angles, though there's no getting around the 1x2x5 bricks that leave it looking a bit too architectural. Personally I'd like to add a few hundred random white bricks to finish it off and make it a complete cave, but we can't really expect LEGO to do that at a reasonable price point.

Of course the Wampa itself is what makes this set a must have for any die hard Star Wars fan. It's a beautiful figure with poseable arms and stick on horns. It might have been nice to have the legs poseable too, but that would push the part count up.

It might have been nice to split this into two sets, since some people might like to have a fleet of speeders, but will only need one wampa in a display (though, I guess there will never be any difficulty disposing of excess wamps on Bricklink).

In conclusion, this is a really nice set, with two great builds, but it does seem a little expensive for the part count.

author: sudorum
title: Small, yet valuable.
review: This set, in itself, is slightly worthless unless you own other Hoth sets that go along with The Empire Strikes Back. However, when combined with other sets, the space it occupies is put to good use. The abominable yeti beast is an original lego piece, and is very accurate. Another original piece is Luke's helmet, though it may not immediately appear so on first glance. The snow speeder isn't anything special, just a modified version present in other sets. The details of the ice cave are unique, though, from the catapult light saber mechanism to the spine of the beastie's latest victim. Don't become a victim of doubt and pass up the opportunity to buy this set.

author: mrvip51
title: BEST SET EVER
review:
This is my all-time favorite set. The wampa in this set can't be beat. The cave is awesome, but a little small.

Pros

1) The wampa can hold other minifigs and is my second favorite minfigure of all time. (#1 is Jabba the Hutt.)

2) the cace is really cool with the ice everywhere

3) the rib cage

4) Luke can hang on the wall

5) the snow speeder is awesome

Cons

1) the ccable on the snow speeder is annoying

2) the cave is kinda small

3) you need to buy echo base to get the tauntaun

 

I totaly agree with Carl, they need to make a new Jabbas Palace

author: tazmancub
title: Great Set
review:
I got this set for Chistmas a month ago and I think it's really cool.I modified the Luke a little bit.For my display I used Kool-Aid under the wampa's severed arm to show blood LOL.


  • Pro's

  • New Wampa.
  • Detailed cave
  • New Luke in hoth gear
  • Cool tauntaun carcass (like in the movie)
  • Saber-shooting action

  • Con's
  • Snowspeeder doesn't really go with the set
  • Luke lacking scars and black eye(I modified it)
  • Zev doesn't have a co-pilot(accurate but dissapointing)
  • It doesn't have Luke's tauntaun
Overall this is an awesome set with great.But, I don't know the price value because I got it for my birthday.

author: verguts
title: To complete the Hoth planet collection
review:
Easy Building and the cave is very authentic.

 

Pros

  • Wampa
  • newer version of the snowspeeder
  • nice work on the cave

Cons

  • Snowspeeder does not fit with other size spaceships

A nice set when you need to complete your Hoth planet collection.

Very playable and easy to set back together, so ideal for children who want to play with their daddy's toys.

author: Waytookeane
title: Really nice Wampa Cave
review:
What a great set. Not too big, well priced, and very playable

Pros

  • Snowspeeder (need I say more?)
  • Very playable and scalable set with 2 distinct parts (speeder & cave)
  • Luke in Hoth gear
  • Cool way Luke is suspended upside down (just like the movie)

Cons

  • What no Taun Taun?

Even without a Taun Taun, this set is really worth getting. Hoth is one of my favourite Lego collections.

author: Colonel14
title: What Snowspeeder is this!? The fifth?
review:
Gee, hasn't LEGO gotten tired of making Hoth Snowspeeders? It doesn't matter. The Hoth Wampa Cave has been discussed by Star Wars fans for ages, people wondering if LEGO will ever make one. And whaddya know: here's the cave, and here's my review of it.

 

The Build

 

TLC deserves a pat on the back for this. Although a little fragile, the cave is made so well it looks like an ice cave. They even made icicles hanging from the ceiling! There's a spot between the icicles where luke can be placed so he's upside-down. The carcas of a previously devoured animal lies inside the cave, and it's a pretty nice touch. A custom-made launcher is in the cave that holds Luke's lightsaber (to make it look like Luke's using the Force to pull the saber towards him). It doesn't work that well...

 

The Snowspeeder is a nice build, and it doesn't take too much attention from the cave. Some stickers are involved, including a viewscreen with an AT-AT on it. The cockpit sits two minifigures. The build is divided into three parts (the cockpit and the two wings). The wings fit in well with the main body of the vessel. Some cable is on the back of the ship that can roll out to wrap up any AT-ATs terrorizing your living room.

 

The Parts

 

This set has its fair share of parts. There are a lot of white mini-slopes and other white slopes (ranging in size), eight mini teeth pieces, a 2x4 flat piece, two cockpit pieces, two cannon pieces, orange slopes, and a mini mountain piece.

 

There are three minifigures, including a large Wampa bigfig. Luke Skywalker comes with a tan Hoth Rebel hat with goggles, and a torso with front and back printings. His lightsaber is blue with a shiny hilt. The pilot has a head with an orange visor, and he comes with a cool helmet. A skeleton comes with this set, a nice addition to the cave. The Wampa has some assembly required: you have to put horms and arms on him. He's pretty big and looks pretty nice.

 

Playability

 

You got nearly all you need to reanact the Wampa Cave scene in Episode V: Luke, hanging from the ceiling, a lightsaber launcher, a wampa, and a Snowspeeder. Add a Tauntaun and Han Solo, and maybe Obi-Wan, and you have the perfect scene.

 

Overall/Value for Money

 

This is a great classic movie scene that every Star Wars LEGO collector should add to his or her shelf. There is a good minifig selection and some nice parts for MOCing. Buy it when you get the chance!

author: Duckuss_Maxximus
title: 8089-1 Hoth Wampa Cave - Walking In A Wampa Wonderland
review:
I was really excited when I first saw this set. WAMPA! I'm sorry but the Yeti from Yeti's Hideout (7412) is NOT a substitute for the Wampa! I guess you had to do what you could back then but not anymore. Another great part about this set is the Snowspeeder. It is a slightly updated version from the previous sets (4500, 7130) but for the most part it's the same Snowspeeder. One good addition to this one is that the windshield is now more movie accurate. Not only is the front part adjustable but now the back part which now has a window is too. The engine turbines turn and the flaps on either side flip up to show components and the wings adjust from flight to landing mode. This time around though the tow-cable is held in place by a megaphone piece as apposed to something a bit more sturdy. I had to flip mine around the other way and shove it down inside the funnel part to get it to stay good. Another thing I don't like is decals. Let's face it, decals are never good. At least in my opinion anyway. The rest of the set has some interesting elements but is more like an entrance than a "cave" which is a bit upsetting. There isn't even anywhere for the wampa to stand unless you reposition some of the floor tiles. I guess you could expand the cave with additional bricks though. The elements in this set are pretty good though. The icicles, skeleton, and ribcage make it feel like the cave from the movie. Also the lightsaber launcher is pretty sweet (kinda) in that you can "use the force" to call Luke's lightsaber to him (or slap him in the face with it, really). The wampa can hold a piece of chicken (or a lightsaber?) and can also hold a minifigure in the other hand to undoubtedly drag prey back to his cave. Luke is outfitted in cold-weather attire, sporting the new Hoth headgear. I feel they should have put some scars on his face from his attack by the wampa. Also I think he should've had a taun-taun. They should make a compartment on taun-tauns to store a minifig. Or at least Han's anyway. You really have to combine Echo Base (7749) with this set (other than 8129) to get the full Hoth effect.

Pros

  • WAMPA!*
  • Updated Snowspeeder*
  • Hoth Luke*
  • Movie accurate elements*
  • Lightsaber launcher* 

Cons

  • Cave is kinda smallx
  • No taun-taun for Luke:(x
  • Decalsx
  • Tow-cable holder is not very sturdyx

All cons aside, this set is awesome and a new essential for any Hoth recreations!

author: HanSolo_Jedi_lego_sik
title: awsome set
review:
It is a good set

Pros

Awsome characters
Wampa!
Lightsaber (my first one)
snowspeeder is really good
pilot is cool
rib cage is awsome
wampas hand which can hold people
and one of my favorite is that you can hang luke upside down from the ceiling

Cons

nothing to use the tow cable for
wierd gun near tow cable
snowspeeders wings fall apart
rock that flngs lightsaber rarely works and theres no way of catching it as it just falls right on the floor again.
hafl a chicken leg, whats up with that?
not really a cave just like an entrance
small cave



It is a good set overall, like the minifigs and it is really good. would recomend it too anyone :D

author: jb_builder
title: good but a little too pricey
review:
I got this set for christmas. I thought it was fairly good when I first saw it. But I think it is over priced $54.99 Canadian for 297 pieces 3 mini figs and a wampa snow beast. Seems a little much.                                                                          

However I still think the set is great and the wampa is awsome! The light saber launcher works all right but not amazing.  The snow speeder is the same as the one that comes with Hoth Echo Base [2007]. But there is more orange on it. I think it looks a bit better then all the gray on the 2007 one. I think the build on the snow speeder was really lame about as lame as the legs on the ATTE [2008]. 

Now for the mini figs.

I love how the pilot Zev Senesca has the arc 170 pilot head. So now the Rebel pilots' actualy have the vissors that they had in the movie's.

Luke has a small jacket on so it looks like he is very small. And I think it looks bad]:

The wampa has lots of detail and the right arm can hold a mini fig so that is pretty good.

 

And I feel I should inform you that this is my first review so hope you like it[:

author: StratTone
title: I think my hopes were to high.
review: Nothing wrong with this set but I am a huge Hoth guy when it comes to star wars and for sure admit I am a bit picky when it comes to anything Hoth.  Not to excited about the cave at all except hanging luke upside down.  The speeder is great don't get me wrong just not a 5 star for me.  Still worth every penny.

author: The_Reviewer
title: The best Star wars set of 2010
review:
I got this set when it first came out and I was looking forward to it and when I got it I was not dissapointed. The set comes with a New Luke Skywalker in Hoth Snow Suit, a new exclusive Wampa and Zev senesca. The cave is ver straightforward yet very detailed;the Taun-Taun Rib bone thing and the skeleton are included and make a more cave feeling;there is a small two stud are where you can hang Luke upside-down and there is the ice thing that you press down on to make it look like Luke is using the force to grab his Lightsaber.  The Snowspeeder is a worthy addition to this set;there is room for two pilots but it only comes with Zev.Oh! and there are stickers you have to put on the snowspeeder.

Pros

  • Great minifigures (Especially the new Wampa)
  • Cave is well thought out
  • Sleek looking Snowspeeder

Cons

  • A little overpiced
  • Stickers (for those who hate them)

 This is definetly a great Star wars set and has an exclusive wampa. Quick! BUY this SET before it is discontinued. -Thanks for Reading

author: babalucci2
title: It's So-So
review: Well, this is $40. It's okay if you ask me. Well the minifigures are good. The Zev Senesca is a new minifigure for 2010. He is in the Rebel Trooper Battle Pack so I was disapointed but the reason I can accept. It's just that he's not rare. And the skeloten is a detail more of than a minifigure. Luke is a cool minifigure. He is new and comes with nice detail and it's just awesome! And the Wampa is a minifigure. He is awesome considering his detail. The minifigures is a 7/10. The snowspeeder is fantastic except for the part the window falls off a lot. It's great detail and it's motor and the harpoon is excelent. The snowspeeder is a 9/10. The next thing or last thing is the cave. The bones is excellent. The lightsaber thing is usefull. It barley flings and will never get to Luke's hand. I like the rock piece and how they made the snow. They should have made it bigger because the Wampa can't fit in the cave. The cave is a 6/10. Overall, this set is a 6/10.

author: Nth_Brick
title: Well... it comes with a Wampa!
review:
I have to say, I sorta bought the set on impulse but, I really can't say I regret it.  It has some cool features, a snowspeeder, the cave, of course and an upside down Luke.  The lightsaber throwing mechanism actually works really well and, if Luke could actually catch it, the lightsaber would fly right into his small, plastic hand.

 

The Wampa has to be one of the highlights of the set and I would nominate for a "Coolest New LEGO Creature of the Year" award.  Both his arms can be angled up and down.  One of his hands is molded to carry the included drumstick while the other is molded to be able to drag along a minifig.  And, of course, he does look very much like a Wampa.

 

What I believe to be about the 4th incarnation of the the snowspeeder really has some good things going for it.  This one has the same old moving flaps and cockpit but, it looks sleeker, weighs less and the cockpit opens all the way.  However, despite how great it is, I just can't shake the feeling that it should be a bit bulkier and, that it feels kind of cheaply designed.  It can still fit two minifigs and has the tow cable that has been on pretty much every other snowspeeder.

 

The Wampa's cave looks fairly good on the outside and the designers probably did the best they could while keeping this set within $40 US.  It has a bone thing that could conceivably be the spine of recently deceased and highly unfortunate Taun-Taun.  Also decorating the interior is a minifig skeleton that seems kinda out of place given that no where in Star Wars canon were other humans eaten by the Wampa that attacked Luke.  It is a nice touch, nonetheless.

 

The minifigs included are a bit disappointing given that a) they are not really all that amazing and b) this set really needed more of them.  We at least need a Han Solo and a Taun-Taun.  Even better would have been for LEGO to include another snowspeeder pilot.  I am pretty sure that you need two to pilot a snowspeeder.  Other than that, I guess the minifigs are good.  It is nice to finally have a Hoth Luke straight from LEGO and another Rebel pilot doesn't hurt.

 

Well, I guess that is all to this set.  Despite a few drawbacks (lack of minifigs, kinda cheap snowspeeder) it is well worth the $40 you have to pay for it.  Especially when you factor in inflation.  So, in the end, I would reccomend that you buy this set before LEGO discontinues them.

 

Thanks for reading,

 

Blockman

author: legoboy123456789
title: what cave?
review:
I think this set is ok. However I was disappointed that it was only the entrance to the cave. I think you are paying for the snow speeder, not the cave. I also think price is too expensive for what you get.

 

Although it has it's downs it also has some positive features. One of these features is how you can suspend Luke upside down just like on the film with his light sabre frozen in the snow. The Wampa is also very accurate, but I don't think the chicken leg brick is very necessary.

author: Shadowtrooper
title: "There's an awesome LEGO set that hit the ground near here, I'm going to check it out..."
review:
Hi! This is Shadowtrooper's first review!  I'm reviewing the 8089 Hoth Wampa Cave

Pros

  • Classic scene
  • Use the "Force" (actually a well made flick-fire mechanism) to free Luke's lightsaber
  • Best looking snowspeeder yet
  • Wampa
  • Chicken leg
  • You can hang Luke upside down in the cave
  • Hoth Luke!
  • Skeleton
  • Realistic cave
  • Lightsaber storage in speeder cockpit
  • Wampa can hold a minifigure in his hand

Cons

  • Pricy (got mine after Christmas on sale 50% off) 
  • Zev Senesca already appeared in one set
  • Stickers, the bane of my existence
  • Snowspeeder cannons are fragile

In my  opinion, the pros outweigh the cons, and you should buy this set before the price goes up, or they sell out.  It goes great with the new Hoth Echo Base (the one with the bacta tanks.)  That's all.  Shadowtrooper out!

===================END TRANSMISSION=========================

author: tkettle9719
title: The cave of Cookie Monster's best friend.
review:
I got this set from Toys 'R Us after Christmas a year ago, mainly for the snowspeeder, which was as amazing as I had foretold, but was disappointed by the cave quite a bit.

Pros

  • -The Snowspeeder looks very movie-accurate, and has an excellent color scheme.
  • -The cave has many cool features, and the wampa is amazing.
  • …

Cons

  • -The use of a launching device for the cable on the snowspeeder would be nice.
  • -The cave feels incomplete, and the lifting lightsaber function doesn't work at all.
  • …

This set is really cool, mainly because of the snowspeeder; it's not that the cave is bad, but it definitely needs a bit more cave to it, to make it feel more complete. I recommend this, but don't expect the cave to be amazing.

author: Chills
title: Luke is in trouble again
review:
I've been working on my Hoth collection recently and came across this set on ebay. Snagged it for under RRP, and it was MISB. Score! So Luke is about to check out an asteriod that hit the ground near him, and before he can get his taun-taun going the Wampa attacks! When Luke comes to he's hanging upside-down in a snow cave with the Wampa nearby eating.

Pros

  • Pro 1: Though this is a rather small set the designers put in a few cool little features. You are really taken back to the difficult situation Luke finds himself in. The cave has the same design features as the Hoth base sets, quite a few white pieces and randomly placed angled bricks. It gives a nice "snowy/icy" effect.
  • Pro 2: Luke hangs not by the holes in the bottom of his feet, but by the ones on the back. Clever design so that he stays put easier. There's a neat little lever you tap to make Luke's lightsaber "fly" to him as the Wampa approaches. Nice addition.
  • Pro 4: You get the feel of a carnivore's cave with bones of different creatures in there.
  • Pro 5: The snowspeeder - a good addition for your Hoth collection. It is almost identical in design to the one in set 7666, but has some slight differences. Plus you get Zev Senesca, Rouge 2, who ends up finding our wayward heroes.
  • Pro 6: It comes with a Wampa eating a turkey leg! Too cool. And you can pop off his arm, just like in ESB.

Cons

  • Con 1: I would have liked to have more bricks for the cave; its a little spare. I think there are more parts to the snowspeeder than the cave and it should be the other way around.
  • Con 2: If Lego could have included a tauntaun that Luke could slip inside to keep warm, that would have been pretty cool... though maybe not too popular with the kids. LOL

Though this set isn't a "must have" to build a proper Hoth Battle scene, having the snowspeeder helps. But if you're collecting Hoth sets you've gotta get this one. It's a cool set, good playability, a fun build, and great minifigures to add to your collection. It would have been nice if the cave was a little bigger and with more bricks, but I'm still quite happy with the set.

author: eggabbey
title: Nice
review:
It's a nice set to have, an easy way to get luke, a wampa, a hoth speeder, and cave tricks.

Pros:

-Good for playing a story.

-Fits the movie

-Includes pieces that arent common

-Has a turkey leg

Inbetween:

-Lightsaber chucker works O.K.

-Isnt to pricey

-Doesn't keep the whole story in the cave

Cons:

-Cave is to small

-Windshield keeps breaking off the hoth speeder

-Cave is crowded

author: Sammy_boy
title: The monster of the cold awaits
review: A good set in general but the cave is less robust than it seems so if you are about to buy this set and you have a reputation to be a bit careless with Lego then this isn't the set for you. The cave might be a bit delicate but the actual Snowspeeder itself does break but if it is dropped or smashed most of the bricks should stay together. The expense itself is okay value for money considering Lego is more expensive now.

author: wii1232
title: A Small Set
review:
When I finished building the set, the snowspeeder looked alright, but the cave itself seemed a bit too small for the big Wampa - even though it had the right details.

However, it should have been a little bit wider AND longer, so that the Wampa had room to sit down to mow on his drumstick(even though that wouldn't be possible for his minifigure, since his body's all one piece except for his arms and horns).

And I also didn't know what the point was of putting Zev and his snowspeeder in there when they didn't put Han and his tauntaun in with it as well.  Because Zev wasn't the only one who rescued Luke in the frozen tundra.  Han rescued him FIRST, and put him in his dead tauntaun.  Then, as we all know, Zev and a few others came in the morning in their snowspeeders to fly them back to Echo Base.  So that's the only part I didn't get about this set.

Aside from that, the length, and the width, it's a must-have for any Hoth set fan.

author: Scott_DaGrot
title: Nice but small
review:
Well when i got into lego again for the first time since being a kid, it was star wars that grabbed my attention. After getting a few of the newer kits however i really wanted something a little older and cool.

What could be cooler than a Wampa cave eh?!

Box/Instructions

Easy to follow instructions and the box is well a box but it did have pretty pictures on it - nothing too special in my view.

Parts

Despite what you create in this set there wasn't many "special" parts bar the wampa itself included, although the tall sloped bricks were a great addition to my collection. Also included were a few stickers that were easy to stick on and were as you may have guessed of the normal solid back format (not the clear stickers with only writing or symbols shown you get in alot of newer sets). I did find the Skeleton and parts for making a remains of a ribcage nice little extras too.

Minifigures

It won't surprise anyone that the reason i bought this set was for the Wampa minfig!! And that guy really is the highlight of this set. A solid body with add on arms (with movement) and horns that are also added - these click in easy enough and i was surprised and pleased the horns were not simply sculpted with the rest of the main body.

Luke is a great looking figure aswell. Really nice print on the torso, both the front and back and also comes with the hoth hat that allows the googles to be resting on the hats brim or worn over the eyes. Only one facial expression and quite a happy one - was hoping for either a scared face or better yet a scarred face for after the wampa attacks but it's a small issue and i'm pretty sure a newer version has been released now anyway.

Finally there's Zev. Nothing special about that guy really though i liked the designs on his helmet. Feels a little too much like an extra fig that was just thrown in. 

The build

I did enjoy building this set although the added snowspeeded meant there wasn't much to be built on the cave, this is a shame as building the cave itself was the part i enjoyed most. The speeder though went together well and though maybe a little dated now is still a nice vehicle.

The completed model

That cave looks great - but it's way too small!!!!! Could easily be added to but for a set named "Hoth Wampa Cave" i was hoping for a little more. The only features of the cave are the lightsabre flicker, this is a simple design that allows luke to call upon the force to retrieve his lightsabre from the ice, the ice ceiling that allows luke (and other figs) to be hung upside down like in the movie and also the Skeleton and ribcage already mentioned.

The snowspeeder looks good but it's only features are the opening cockpit and useable Tow cable on the back. Could just be that it shows it's age as i'm more used to newer vehicles but overall feels a little over simplified. Displays nicely though and is a good size. 

Overall opinion

Overall this is a fantastic kit for any Star Wars fans and especially fans of Empire strikes back - Like me!!!! Getting a little harder to find at a good price now so worth picking up if you can find it new and sealed. 

6/10 overall. It's saving grace really was the Wampa, personally i would have preferred seeing a Han Solo and Tauntaun figures over the snowspeeder and the cave to be bigger but overall it's a nice build that displays well. Plus this set can easily be added to or worked into a Star Wars Hoth display.

author: alfred_the_buttler
title: Fantastic Set, Although Needs to be Combined with 7749
review:
I picked this set up from a garage sale along with 7749 which compliments this set perfectly. I will say that these two sets do seem a little mixed up however as Han and his tauntaun seem more appropriate with this set and the snowspeeder more appropriate with the Echo Base set. Why is there a tauntaun at an Echo Vase bunker? I don’t think Han would stand a chance going up against an AT-AT on a tauntaun. Of course if you can get both sets then I guess it doesn’t really matter, but otherwise the model selection is a little odd for both of these sets. Now onto this set. 

First of all, the name is a little misleading, yes it is a wampa cave, but the snowspeeder is a much larger build. So let’s analyze the two components separately, because let’s face it, they are unrelated.

The cave

the cave is very simple, almost Lego Juniors simple, but still looks very nice with the rib cage and skeleton minifigure great details (not to mention you now have a skeleton minifigure). It is made of mostly larger bricks which is nice since you aren’t paying for lots of smaller bricks. It looks very nice. Luke hangs very well by the back of his legs. There is also a nice little feature that shoots out his light saber from the ice using the force (of your finger) although it doesn’t fly out, just kind of falls out but is still fun. 

Of course Luke looks great but I don’t think there is anything in the details that screams this is Luke. He could easily be confused for any rebel. But the wampa is what this set is all about. His arms move (and can be removed) but his legs are rigid. He looks great and can hold Luke as well as his chicken leg. 

This cave is a lot of fun even if it is simple. I’d recommend this set for the cave alone. 

The snowspeeder

you probably aren’t buying this set for a snowspeeder, but at the same time you won’t be disappointed by it. A slightly more complex build but still very simple. Aesthetically however it looks great with a lot of attention to detail. Playability wise it offers you a tow hook, which is really all you need to take down an AT-AT. It looks as if it can seat two minifigures but in reality can only seat one as they need to recline in order to close the cockpit. The cockpit appears to have two hinges, but only the back hinge is functional. 

Parts

the set may not have too many unique pieces, but does have a lot of useful pieces if you want to build anything ice related.

Playability

This is of course what this set is all about. Fighting wampas and flying snowspeeders. The solid construction also makes it great as it won’t fall apart while playing with it. I wish the wampas legs could move, but not a big deal, the fact you can cut off his arm is good enough.

Overall

I highly recommend this set, especially if you combine it with 7749. Then just add an AT-AT and your Hoth is complete!
